results.title: He Guarded Haiti’s Slain President. And He Was a Suspect in a Drug Inquiry.
results.abstract: Officials are examining whether President Jovenel Moïse’s killing was tied to the drug trade. The man in charge of his safety was a suspect in a major trafficking case, they say.

results.title: Athens Is Only Getting Hotter. Its New ‘Chief Heat Officer’ Hopes to Cool It Down.
results.abstract: Eleni Myrivili has been tasked with finding ways to help the Greek capital cope with ever-hotter heat waves that are expected to be part of life for years to come.

results.title: Fears Rise About Safety of Afghan Airport as U.S. Warns Americans to Stay Away
results.abstract: Families continued to swarm the airport in hopes of getting aboard American military planes. U.S. officials are now worried that Islamic State might launch an attack to damage the Taliban’s sense of control.

results.title: America’s Afghan War: A Defeat Foretold?
results.abstract: Recent history suggests that it is foolish for Western powers to fight wars in other people’s lands and that the U.S. intervention was almost certainly doomed from the start.

results.title: The Struggle to Save a House of Music, and Its Legacy
results.abstract: For decades, the Tangier home of Abdellah El Gourd has been a wellspring of the Gnawa musical tradition and a place of pilgrimage for jazz performers. But it has fallen into deep disrepair.

results.title: How the Taliban Turned Social Media Into a Tool for Control
results.abstract: In the 1990s, they banned the internet. Now they use it to threaten and cajole the Afghan people, in a sign of how they might use technology to build power.

results.title: ‘Super Taster’ Who Lost Sense of Smell Is Helping Italians Regain It
results.abstract: A celebrated epicure in Italy was devastated when Covid-19 first stole, then warped his sense of taste. Through training, Michele Crippa has recaptured some of it and is now on a quest to aid others.

results.abstract: The video clips suggest that almost a week after the Taliban seized Kabul, conditions near the airport are not improving and may be worsening.

results.title: Desperation as Afghans Seek to Flee a Country Retaken by the Taliban
results.abstract: A surging crowd trampled a toddler to death near the airport, and many residents who aided America remain in hiding, fearing they will be killed by their new rulers.

results.title: Biden’s Inaccurate Claims in Defending Afghanistan Withdrawal
results.abstract: The president made misleading or false claims about the reaction of allies to the withdrawal, the presence of Al Qaeda and conditions for Americans traveling to the Kabul airport.

results.title: As Canada Awaits a New Group of Refugees, Questions Loom
results.abstract: Canada said that it would take in 20,000 refugees from Afghanistan. But Canadians hoping to sponsor some of them will have to wait until government plans become clear.

results.title: Evgeny Sveshnikov, Grandmaster and Theorist of Chess, Dies at 71
results.abstract: He made significant contributions to the theory of the game, particularly the openings, one of which is named for him.

results.title: Dr. Gino Strada, Who Brought Health Care to the Desperate, Dies at 73
results.abstract: He was a force behind Emergency, which operates clinics, hospitals, trauma centers and other institutions throughout the world.
org_facet: Emergency - Life Support for Civilian Victims of War and Poverty

results.title: Patience Runs Thin in Haiti Quake Zone as Fights Erupt for Cash and Food
results.abstract: Nearly a week after a magnitude 7.2 earthquake wreaked death and devastation in southern Haiti, survivors were growing increasingly frantic over the slow trickle of relief.
results.byline: By Anatoly Kurmanaev and Maria Abi-Habib

results.title: ‘We will get you home.’ Biden vows to rescue Americans despite mayhem in Kabul.
results.abstract: The president acknowledged, however, that he did not know how many Americans were still in Afghanistan.

results.title: Nicole Kidman’s Quarantine Pass Generates Anger in Hong Kong
results.abstract: The actress, in Hong Kong to film a series about wealthy expatriates, was allowed to skip a coronavirus quarantine. Residents saw the exemption as deeply unfair, and it became a point of debate among lawmakers.

multimedia.caption: Nicole Kidman managed to bypass Hong Kong’s quarantine rules, after arriving from Sydney, Australia, last week.
